physical_appearance: This is a black-and-white photograph of a post and telegraph office. It features a single-storey roofed building, with a building sign printed at the top-front of the building. There is a group of men standing on the right side of the building. There is a bicycle parked on the front-left of the building. There is a road path that leads to the front door of the building.
sgcool_label_text: A variety of portraits of British soldiers that show them at leisure as well as two photographs of James Steele placing a wreath at a remembrance ceremony, this collection is part of the archive of James Steele, Royal Artillery (Field) who served in Malaya from January 1941-February 1942, when interned as a P.O.W at Changi until his release in October 1945.
title_text: Group of 50 photographs of P.O.W James Steele and regiment when stationed in Malaysia in 1941 (and 2 later photographs of Steele placing a wreath at ceremony of remembrance)  Post Office, Mersing 1941
subject_terms_1: world wars black-and-white photographs post offices telegraph offices
subject_terms_2: World War, 1939-1945 Photography Postal service Telegraph
context_7: Great Britain. Army. Royal Field Artillery
